intro: Semele menezesii subvar. prolica, commonly known as the Madre de Cielo, is a rare and endemic plant species native to specific regions of South America. It is characterized by its delicate, fern-like foliage and produces small, clustered white or pale green flowers. The plant thrives in shaded, moist environments, often found in cloud forests or mountainous regions. Its leaves are typically leathery and have a unique, intricate venation pattern. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
